alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 10 at 10:10PM CDT until September 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR ARMSTRONG...RANDALL...CARSON...EASTERN DEAF SMITH AND POTTER COUNTIES... At 1010 PM CDT, automated weather equipment reported severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles southeast of Masterson to 8 miles southeast of Buffalo Lake, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. At 957 PM CDT, automated weather equipment recorded a 63 mph wind gust 15 miles north northwest of Amarillo. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Panhandle, Claude, Lake Tanglewood, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Wayside, Washburn, Umbarger, Palo Duro Canyon, Mescalero Park, Dawn, Timbercreek Canyon, and Pantex. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
